title: MD
biography: António Caetano de Abreu Freire Egas Moniz, known as simply Egas Moniz, was a Portuguese neurologist and the developer of cerebral angiography. He is regarded as one of the founders of modern psychosurgery, having developed the surgical procedure leucotomy—​better known today as lobotomy—​for which he became the first Portuguese national to receive a Nobel Prize in 1949.
aiSummary: António Egas Moniz is a neurology specialist with an H-index of 37 at University of Lisbon (Member). Has been published in Comprehensive Reviews in Food Science and Food Safety, Critical Reviews in Food Science and Nutrition, npj Science of Food. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
knowsAbout: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine
